front.question: The most important consideration at the scene of a hazardous materials incident is:

choices: stares at certain parts of another person’s anatomy.
requests sexual favors in exchange for something else.
makes rude remarks about a person’s body parts.
touches another person without his or her consent.
front.question: Quid pro quo, a type of sexual harassment, occurs when the harasser:

cards.back: requests sexual favors in exchange for something else.

choices: increased self-image from performing well under a challenging situation.
the inability to remain focused, because the task at hand is demanding.
short term loss of energy due to the high physical demands of the job.
long-term feelings of being overwhelmed by the nature of the call.
front.question: Characteristics of eustress following dispatch to a high-speed motor vehicle collision may include:
front.source: See General Health, Wellness, and Resilience

cards.back: increased self-image from performing well under a challenging situation.

front.question: The spread of HIV and hepatitis in the healthcare setting can usually be traced to:

choices: use a bleach and water solution at a 1:2 dilution ratio to thoroughly wipe all surfaces.
clean all surfaces and patient contact areas with a mixture of alcohol and water.
allow surfaces to air dry unless otherwise indicated in the product directions.
spray the contaminated areas and then immediately wipe them dry with a towel.
front.question: When decontaminating the back of your ambulance after a call, you should:

cards.back: allow surfaces to air dry unless otherwise indicated in the product directions.

choices: have been infected with hepatitis A in the past.
are older than 35 years of age.
front.question: Vaccination against the hepatitis A virus is unnecessary if you:

cards.back: have been infected with hepatitis A in the past.

choices: the TB disease is currently dormant but might later become active.
you are actively infected with TB.
you have been exposed to TB.
you have never been exposed to TB.
front.question: A positive TB skin test indicates that:

cards.back: you have been exposed to TB.

front.question: What should you do before attempting to access a patient trapped in a vehicle?
Which of the following is the most significant factor in determining whether a person will become ill from certain germs?

choices: punitive action and the loss of a job.
low morale and frequently missed shifts.
front.question: The most serious consequence of drug or alcohol abuse among EMS personnel is:
The capacity of an individual to cope with and recover from stress is called:
front.source: See Caring for Critically Ill and Injured Patients

front.question: A critical incident stress debriefing should be conducted no longer than ________ hours following the incident.
front.source: See Stress Management on the Job

choices: providing large amounts of caffeine to the rescue workers.
requesting a CISM team to provide on-scene peer support.
conducting a critical incident stress debriefing the next day.
allowing each worker to sleep in 15- to 30-minute increments.
front.question: You have been working at the scene of a major building collapse for eight hours. Many injured people are still being removed, and everyone is becoming frustrated and losing focus. This situation is most effectively managed by:
front.source: See Stress Management on the Job

cards.back: requesting a CISM team to provide on-scene peer support.

front.question: Vectorborne transmission of an infectious organism occurs via:
Hazards that are associated with a structural fire include all of the following, except:

choices: are not secured with a strap.
offer little or no side protection.
front.question: Prescription glasses do not provide adequate eye protection because they:

cards.back: offer little or no side protection.

front.question: Which of the following infectious diseases confers no protection from reinfection after exposure?

choices: Alarm response, reaction and resistance, and recovery
Delayed reaction, alarm response, and physical recovery
Immediate reaction, psychological exhaustion, and recovery
Reaction and resistance, euphoria, and physical exhaustion
front.question: General adaptation syndrome is characterized by which of the following phases?
front.source: See Stress Management on the Job

cards.back: Alarm response, reaction and resistance, and recovery

choices: wash your hands in between patient contacts.
undergo annual testing for tuberculosis and hepatitis.
ensure that your immunizations are up-to-date.
front.question: The simplest, yet most effective method of preventing the spread of an infectious disease is to:

cards.back: wash your hands in between patient contacts.

choices: wear socks made of heavy-duty cotton.
wear at least three layers of clothing.
wear a heavy, thick jacket or coat.
front.question: The most effective way to preserve your own body heat when functioning in cold, wet weather is to:

cards.back: wear at least three layers of clothing.
